extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite    Restricted to students in the B.N.Sc. program and 4U BIOL
Exclusion    ANAT100, ANAT101; ANAT215, ANAT216, PHGY210, PHGY212, PHGY214

basic.description: An introduction to basic anatomy and physiological principles with emphasis on the clinical relevance of the structure and function of human body systems. Topics include nerve, sensory, skeleto-muscular, respiratory, cardiovascular, renal, endocrine and digestive systems. Admission restricted to students in the B.N.Sc. program and major or medial programs in Health Studies in the Faculty of Arts & Science. 3 hours lecture per week plus 2 hours tutorial; alt.weeks; 18 units (6 credits) course weight.
basic.subject: IDIS
basic.title: Intro To Anatomy & Physiology
